intro: Urtica fernandeziana, commonly known as the Fernández stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with fine, hair-like structures that can cause a stinging sensation upon contact. It produces small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Urtica fernandeziana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
